clinical_study.brief_title: Flavoring Oral Contrast for MR Enterography
clinical_study.official_title: Flavoring Oral Contrast for MR Enterography

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: To determine if patient satisfaction, participation, and image quality improves with flavored oral contrast for MR enterography.

detailed_description.textblock: Volumen is an oral contrast agent used in MR imaging of the bowel. It has an unpleasant taste which makes it difficult for pediatric patients, especially sick pediatric patients, to drink. There are other contrast materials used in the department that are flavored to improved patient participation. The investigators hope to determine a way to flavor Volumen to improve patient participation. In doing so, the investigators hope to also improve patient satisfaction as well as imaging quality.

primary_outcome.measure: the number of patients that prefer flavored contrast
primary_outcome.description: the number of patients that prefer flavored contrast will be evaluated by a questionaire

primary_outcome.measure: bowel diameter measurements on MR Enterography
primary_outcome.description: bowel diameter measurements will be made by two radiologists on MR Enterography

arm_group.description: This group of patients will have the choice to flavor their contrast.
This group of patients will drink the contrast without flavoring.

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients undergoing MR enterography examinations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pediatric patients having a MR enterography
Exclusion Criteria:
- sedated patients
